bwwExcerpt: Tuneful, schlocky, and deeply offensive unless you have a take-it-or-leave-it approach to female agency, the Broadway musical Pretty Woman turns on the adorably chaste question of whether or not a boy and a girl will kiss on the lips. They will. But only after they've kissed everywhere else first. Not that you will see any sex. This love story about a free-spirited prostitute and her john is a family show! Get your mind out of the proscenium.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Tuneful, schlocky, and deeply offensive unless you have a take-it-or-leave-it approach to female agency...The score...is perfectly pleasant, but except for a couple of riffs so macho-sounding they suggest a penis as plectrum, it is also perfectly unremarkable...The dance numbers seem borrowed from bar mitzvah B-roll and the shopping scene, which should be a triumph, is just no fun...Thereâ€™s far more engineering and care devoted to the lingerie than to the story structure."
